funGUI

Class NumTextInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • funGUI.TextStrip
      • funGUI.NumTextInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants

    public class NumTextInput
extends TextStrip
implements processing.core.PConstants
    Really just a TextStrip that only allows numerical inputs such as 10E-2, otherwise known as 10 times 10 to the power of 2, or 3.14, etc.
    Author:
    Audrey Seo

      • NumTextInput

        public NumTextInput(processing.core.PApplet p,
                    float x,
                    float y,
                    float w,
                    float h)
        Constructor of the numerics-only text strip class.
        Parameters:
        p - PApplet, the parent sketch, usually "this"
        x - float, the x-coordinate of the number input box
        y - float, the y-coordinate of the number input box
        w - float, the width of the number input box
        h - float, the height of the number input box

      • NumTextInput

        public NumTextInput(processing.core.PApplet p,
                    float x,
                    float y,
                    float w,
                    float h,
                    java.lang.String name)
        Constructor of the numerics-only text strip class.
        Parameters:
        p - PApplet, the parent sketch, usually "this"
        x - float, the x-coordinate of the number input box
        y - float, the y-coordinate of the number input box
        w - float, the width of the number input box
        h - float, the height of the number input box
        name - String, the instructions for the user that will be to the left of the number input box, e.g. "Birthdate: "

      • NumTextInput

        public NumTextInput(processing.core.PApplet p,
                    float x,
                    float y,
                    float w,
                    float h,
                    boolean scientific)
        Constructor of the numerics-only version of text strip class.
        Parameters:
        p - PApplet, the parent sketch, usually "this"
        x - float, the x-coordinate of the number input box
        y - float, the y-coordinate of the number input box
        w - float, the width of the number input box
        h - float, the height of the number input box
        scientific - boolean, whether or not this input box allows scientific notation in the form of "1x10^exponent"
